comment: She is always late; rude when answering questions; she made the class on online even through it is in person cause she is sick, but she wasn't; very lazy; doesn't respond to emails
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Beware of pop quizzes--So many papers

comment: God. This teacher basically makes you learn by yourself. The class is an easy A, but you don't learn anything. She always showed up at least 10 minutes late to class and would leave occasionally while we were working from the textbooks to go play phone games in her car. Her tests are all true and false (but they're easy). Overall easy but annoying.

She shows up late, is hard to contact outside of class, does not respond to emails. Helpful in class. Easy A most quizzes and tests are multiple-choice and straight from the PowerPoints. Some are auto- CAD drawings. You will need to buy the textbook because she teaches directly from there for auto-CAD. Very lenient with grades.

She is always late and not very helpful in class regarding assignments. She is lenient with grades. The class is an easy A, but you do NOT learn much here. She also NEVER responds to emails; there is absolutely no way to communicate with her outside of class.
Always extremely late and very lazy. Makes it very clear she does not care about the class.

Lectures are very boring. Test and quizzes are based on PowerPoints. She doesnt put any of the work that you do in for a grade. She does not check her email. Teams is the only way to get in contact with her. However, she is very nice and willing to work with you if you fall behind.

Very caring teacher. She will often stay after class to answer students' questions and make sure that they understand. The class was easy and we worked straight out of the textbook. There were a couple of easy assignments, and we worked straight out of the textbooks for the exams.

Her class is an easy A. She is open to re-opening assignments if you happened to miss them. Quizzes and exams are open-note. She never responded to my emails that had questions. She uses Microsoft Teams for lectures (not a big fan). She is knowledgeable of AutoCAD Civil 3D, however, her lectures are bland (kind of boring...)
rating_tags: Graded by few things--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: I loved her so much. When I was confused about a unit, she went back and explained it to me. She really cares about the students, so please treat her well because she is a gem to have! There are quizzes, graphics assignments, etc. that are generally okay because she teaches fairly well!
What an awesome teacher this was. Made the course very enjoyable and not too hard at the same time. Can't anything but good things about her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring

comment: I really did not like this professor. She is nice and all, but I could care less about that. If I had to describe this professor in one word, it would be lazy. Her curriculum is literally just chapter work and provides no real life application to the skills that are learned. I was not a fan of her.

Near the end of the semester, class wasn't necessary. You just work straight out of the textbook, but should be done to do well on the final. Final was open textbook and works in AutoCAD. She tells you when a quiz is coming up and theyre online and open book. 1 test was not open book but easy if you studied the powerpoints she posts.

Overall decent professor. She has a moderately thick accent, so sit in the front if you need to. You will need A Practical Guide to AutoCAD Civil 3D and a basic drafting kit+paper. She will help when asked, but most of the class is just working through the book. The quizzes are so easy (online+open book) as well as the tests. Research your options.
